elements.name: question3
elements.title: The sweater shrunk the first time it was washed, so this is a hidden defect. As the customer fulfilled her duty of notification and reported the defect immediately, her claim for a refund is justified.

elements.name: question2
elements.title: Justification/correction:
elements.correctAnswer: The seller is not liable for defects caused by improper use (Art. 201 OR - notice of defects). The care instructions can be found on the product. In addition, the seller verbally pointed this out when she handed over the sweater to the customer in perfect condition.

elements.name: question4
elements.title: Justification/correction:
elements.correctAnswer: There is no legal obligation to offer goodwill measures. Goodwill is by definition voluntary.

elements.name: question5
elements.title: If the customer can show that the damage is due to a manufacturing defect (e.g. incorrect care instructions on the label), the seller is obliged to provide a warranty.

elements.name: question6
elements.title: Justification/correction:
elements.correctAnswer: The customer could hardly have detected the defect during a normal inspection of the product and therefore did not disregard her duty to inspect (Art. 201 CO - notice of defects). The retailer would therefore be liable for this defect, which is only recognizable during use (Art. 197 CO - Warranty).
